ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and you have an insatiable love of wealth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And love wealth with all your heart.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and love the riches, loving them ardently.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and why do you have an excessive love of riches?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And you harbour intense love for wealth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you love wealth with love Jamma.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And you love wealth with exceeding love.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and you love wealth with an ardent love
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And love wealth with abounding love.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and you have a love of wealth which can never be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And ye love riches with exceeding love.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and love wealth with much fondness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And ye love wealth with inordinate love!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you love wealth with much love!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And you love wealth with immense love.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And you love wealth with immense love.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:20] and they love wealth with abounding love, that is to say, greatly, and so they do not expend [any] of it (a variant reading in the case of all four verbs has the second person plural).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And love wealth with abounding love.
